definition: Military communication that reports tactical status, target locations, or operational conditions

positive_examples: The forward observer radioed the coordinates of the enemy position to artillery command
Charlie Company submitted their hourly situation report detailing troop movements and casualty status
The pilot confirmed target acquisition and provided laser designation for the incoming missile
Ground control transmitted updated enemy positions to the strike team via encrypted channels
The reconnaissance unit reported hostile vehicle locations using GPS coordinates
Command received a detailed briefing on ammunition levels and equipment readiness from all units
negative_examples: The general gave an inspiring speech to boost morale before the mission
The sergeant issued direct orders for the platoon to advance at dawn
Military personnel discussed strategy during the planning meeting
The officer announced new regulations regarding leave policies
Soldiers shared personal stories during their break between patrols
The commander declared victory after the successful operation
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: MilitaryCommanding, MilitaryAnnouncing, PolicyStating, OfficialDeclaration
